content: Christ is risen from the dead, and become the firstfruits of them that slept. For since by man came death, by man came also the resurrection of the dead. For as in Adam all die, even so in Christ shall all be made alive. 1 Cor. 15:20 Glory be to the Father, and to the Son, and to the Holy Ghost; As it was in the beginning, is now, and ever shall be, world without end. Amen. The Collect for Easter Sunday (Resurrection Day) [Collect = a Group Prayer] B.C.P. 1928 ALMIGHTY God, who through thine only-begotten Son Jesus Christ hast overcome death, and opened unto us the gate of everlasting life; We humbly beseech thee that, as by thy special grace preventing* us thou dost put into our minds good desires, so by thy continual help we may bring the same to good effect; through the same Jesus Christ our Lord, who liveth and reigneth with thee and the Holy Ghost ever, one God, world without end. Amen. From The Gospel of Luke chapter 24: ..."Why seek ye the living among the dead ? He is not here, but is risen... * "Preventing" means - "go before" or allowing.

title: Resurrection Day! 2009

content: T, from reading some of your posts on the 'shoot 'em up' thread on guns, I could imagine your guy resurrected with a gun in his hand seeking revenge? Is that correct? It must be hard to be a gun toting Christian on Easter?
reply: T, from reading some of your posts on the 'shoot 'em up' thread on guns, I could imagine your guy resurrected with a gun in his hand seeking revenge? Is that correct? It must be hard to be a gun toting Christian on Easter?
title: Resurrection Day! 2009

content: quote: Originally posted by swremwin: Christ is risen from the dead, and become the firstfruits of them that slept. For since by man came death, by man came also the resurrection of the dead. For as in Adam all die, even so in Christ shall all be made alive. 1 Cor. 15:20 Glory be to the Father, and to the Son, and to the Holy Ghost; As it was in the beginning, is now, and ever shall be, world without end. Amen. The Collect for Easter Sunday (Resurrection Day) [Collect = a Group Prayer] B.C.P. 1928 ALMIGHTY God, who through thine only-begotten Son Jesus Christ hast overcome death, and opened unto us the gate of everlasting life; We humbly beseech thee that, as by thy special grace preventing* us thou dost put into our minds good desires, so by thy continual help we may bring the same to good effect; through the same Jesus Christ our Lord, who liveth and reigneth with thee and the Holy Ghost ever, one God, world without end. Amen. From The Gospel of Luke chapter 24: ..."Why seek ye the living among the dead ? He is not here, but is risen... * "Preventing" means - "go before" or allowing. ALLELUIA!!!ALLELUIA!!!ALLELUIA!!! What a glorious time of renewal for all of His followers Shane. Jesus Christ is The One who welcomes all people into the love that we share with Him, in Him and through Him. Just as the culmination of His life and deeds on earth were a way for renewal into the arms of The One and only True God, on Easter we celebrate this time of renewal for mankind. To understand that He lives inside of me and I am a part of Him that transcends the dying of the body and am forever alive in unity with Him is the greatest gift of understanding that I have been given through my knowing Him. This is the celebration of Easter, the Resurrection of the body and the knowing of our future path after death in union with Jesus Christ The Son to The Father. To all of you I have loved and to all who have loved me I embrace you and wish you strength in your continued quest for a "full" life. Happy Easter - LegionSon -

title: Resurrection Day! 2009

content: Happy Easter... I put this out on another thread for the Fire/EMS community. Legions post makes me want to share it here... Contemplating this Easter. I find it does not matter what you do, in what industry... Times are tough! I was looking for a way to motivate myself even in these tough times, it slowly came to me... When have times been tougher? The great depression, 1942, 2001! There was a time much, much worse. Imagine leaving everything, changing your life for a man who promised the unusual, yet spoke with crystal clarity and truth. Then watching him die along with all of your dreams, proving your choices where wrong, on the day we remember as Good Friday! With all hope lost these believers, this small group who had sacraficed all, heard and then found this man had risen from his grave! Turning lost hope from despair into salvation for not just that small group, but for all! An incredible turn of events. Easter 09 is yet again, maybe even more so now than before, the start of something new. A new beginning. Just like it has been all along! This year we just understand it better as we too, experience despair and some loss of hope. Maybe we can better appreciate what this day really means, the day despair became overcome forever... CJ Chaplain Kerr ESD 1
